alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampshire; Northern Worcester; Western Franklin; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 5:04PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Worcester, northwestern Hampshire and Franklin Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 502 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Swanzey, NH to Florida, MA. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Brief heavy downpours can be expected. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Heavy rain may cause ponding of water or minor flooding in areas that drain water poorly. Locations impacted include... Leominster, Fitchburg, Amherst, Greenfield, Orange, Deerfield, Gardner, Athol, Winchendon, Montague, Templeton, Westminster, Ashburnham, Hadley, Hubbardston, Sunderland, Hatfield, Northfield, Williamsburg and Bernardston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed.
